alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Floyd; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alleghany, northern Surry, northwestern Wilkes, southeastern Watauga and southeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, Floyd, Carroll and western Patrick Counties in southwestern Virginia through 700 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel Fork to near Deep Gap. The heaviest rain was falling along parts of the Blue Ridge Parkway. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roads. Locations impacted include... Boone... Mount Airy... Galax... Flat Rock... Hillsville... Sparta... and Dobson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Watch for downed tree limbs. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
